context_bundle.summary: PhiSHRI session continuity protocol: Use door codes as stateless context checkpoints enabling AI agents to resume work across sessions with zero context loss. Bootstrap file + door codes + parallel reads = 5-second onboarding vs 5-minute rebuild.

onboarding.quick_start: Session handoff: 1) Read C:\Temp\VSCC_SESSION_BOOTSTRAP.md, 2) Read INDEX.json for current state (267 doors), 3) Read relevant doors in parallel, 4) Continue work. No context drift, no re-explaining, instant pickup.
common_patterns: Bootstrap pattern: Session bootstrap file (C:\Temp\VSCC_SESSION_BOOTSTRAP.md) contains progress, last batch completed, next batch options
Door code checkpoint: 'Resume from doors: S19-S25, W132-W145, R17-R23, T28-T29' loads full Batch 8A context
Parallel loading: Read multiple doors in single message (5-7 doors) for 30-50% token savings
Index verification: Check INDEX.json total_doors field to confirm system state
Work continuation: Bootstrap specifies 5 next batch options, user chooses direction

known_errors.error: New session agent asks 'What were we working on?' despite bootstrap file
known_errors.cause: Bootstrap file not read, agent starting from scratch
known_errors.solution: ALWAYS read C:\Temp\VSCC_SESSION_BOOTSTRAP.md as first action in new session
known_errors.prevention: Bootstrap file path hardcoded in session startup instructions

known_errors.error: Agent re-reads doors sequentially causing 12+ second load time
known_errors.cause: Not using parallel Read calls, reading doors one at a time
known_errors.solution: Batch door reads in single message: Read S19, S20, S21, S22, S23 in parallel

known_errors.error: Session handoff loses information about what was just completed
known_errors.cause: Bootstrap file not updated with completed batch details
known_errors.solution: Update bootstrap after each batch: Progress section, What Was Completed section, Next Batch options
known_errors.prevention: Make bootstrap update part of batch completion workflow

session_continuity_benefits.description: PhiSHRI enables perfect multi-session continuity through door codes and bootstrap files

traditional_approach.context_drift: High (each session loses fidelity, summaries compress information)

phishri_approach.method: Door codes + bootstrap file + parallel reads
phishri_approach.context_drift: Zero (doors are immutable, same content every session)
phishri_approach.scalability: Excellent (constant time regardless of project age)

sections.current_progress: Doors completed by batch, running total
sections.what_was_completed: Detailed list of last batch (door codes + descriptions)
sections.critical_fixes: Any system-level fixes (index rebuilds, bug fixes)
sections.next_batch_options: 5 suggested directions for next work (user chooses)
sections.file_structure: Current state of PhiSHRI directory tree
sections.important_notes: Gotchas (folder name typo, zero hallucinations protocol)
sections.commands: How to rebuild indexes after adding doors

bootstrap_file_structure.size_constraint: Keep under 5K tokens for fast loading

example_handoff.scenario: Session N completes Batch 8A (30 doors), Session N+1 needs to continue

actions: See: Batch 8A complete, 267 doors, 5 options for Batch 9A
Read relevant prerequisite doors in parallel if needed (optional)
User explains: 'We were adding security doors to PhiSHRI'
Agent asks: 'What is PhiSHRI? What doors exist? What was last completed?'
User provides long context dump or points to previous conversation
Agent reads previous conversation or docs (slow, incomplete)

for_agents: ALWAYS read bootstrap file first in new session
Use parallel Read calls for doors (5-7 in single message)
Update bootstrap after completing each batch
Verify INDEX.json total_doors matches expected count
Rebuild indexes after adding doors (python rebuild_phishri_indexes.py)
for_users: Keep bootstrap file up to date with progress
Use door codes in requests: 'Read S19-S25' vs 'Tell me about security'
Take note of door codes for topics you reference often
Run /compact periodically to create session summaries
Specify batch preferences to guide agent (size, focus areas)
